briefdescription.para: Entry into R factor evaluation function.
tolerance of R factors for termination
initial displacement of parameters from input geometry (used to set up the vertex for sr_amoeba)
tolerance criterion in function brent() (used in linmin() )
R factor type used for minimisation.
step in the search for min.
half of the search range for min.
indicated that the above parameters have been defined

memberdef.name: OPEN_ERROR
memberdef.initializer: fprintf(STDERR, \ "*** error (SEARCH): could not open file \"%s\"\n", x)

memberdef.name: SR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED_ERROR

briefdescription.para: Use downhill simplex or amoeba (sx) method.
indicates search method is not yet implemented.

detaileddescription.para: This is particularly relevant if compiling when defining _USE_GSL as not all the search methods have been ported to use the GNU Scientific Library API.

briefdescription.para: Indicates the input file format is invalid or file not specified.
Indicates the vertex backup file format is not correct or file not specified.
Indicates that system call returned non-zero.
Indicates an issue with the specified symmetry for the given input.
Indicates that memory could not be allocated.
Indicates error code for function success.
Structure for containing all the parameters of a given search.

detaileddescription.para:
Georg Held g.held@reading.ac.uk
Liam Deacon liam.deacon@diamond.ac.uk This include file defines all the additional data structures, type declarations and constant values needed for the search program.
